FuncDef:
The radius-server format-attribute calling-station-id user-defined command configures an encapsulation format for the Calling-Station-Id attribute.
The undo radius-server format-attribute calling-station-id command deletes the configured encapsulation format for the Calling-Station-Id attribute.
By default, no encapsulation format is specified for the Calling-Station-Id attribute.

ParaDef.Info:
The Calling-Station-Id attribute is generated in the following format:
{lag-Trunkid|eth Slot/Subslot/Port}:Pvlan.Cvlan#SystemName###pppoe mac-address#.
Slot specifies a slot ID, Subslot specifies a sub-slot ID, and Port specifies a port number.Pvlan specifies an outer VLAN ID, Cvlan specifies an inner VLAN ID. If no VLAN exists, Pvlan and Cvlan are set to 0.mac-address specifies a physical address. The value of mac-address is separated by a semicolon (:).
The other fields are fixed.
-

ExtraInfo: Different RADIUS servers have different requirements for attribute formats. To configure a device to encapsulate the Calling-Station-Id attribute in the version3 format, run the radius-server format-attribute calling-station-id user-defined version3 command.
